metadata.Title: CVE-2022-20009 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In various functions of the USB gadget subsystem, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-213172319References: Upstream kernel

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20009` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1110-aws - 4.4.0-1110.116
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1138-azure - 4.15.0-1138.151~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-230-generic - 4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-230-generic - 4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-230-lowlatency - 4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1138-azure - 4.15.0-1138.151~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-230-generic - 4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-230-generic - 4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-230-lowlatency - 4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: alexmurray> Apparently this is a duplicate of CVE-2022-25258 and CVE-2022-25375

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1110.116').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1138.151~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1138.151~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1').
